column4: so does a '/etc/init.d/networking restart' also take a long time on 'lo'?
I dunno. I've never done that.
I just did /etc/init.d/networking restart now and it only took ~5 seconds.
actually it might... I haven't rebooted since I commented out "auto eth0" in /etc/networking/interfaces... haha. I just took a quick stab at a solution this morning but never tested it.
hehe, but did it help poor Fazer..
I dunno. I think it would though. I don't think he's gonna get the stock module to work with his chipset, so he's gonna have to compile his own I'll bet.
i like 'plow' it's easy to remember
I'm the same way. I think, however, that we are few.
the finder assumes software is lost already. odd concept
like wolves amongst sheep, we walk among them
hehe strange redirection of the question there.
yes, he's close to breaking his system.
What mount is that drive that he's gonna 777?
he wants all users to be able to mount, read write execute on the partition.
